SUMMARY: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

Class Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter

Extends Ext.ux.netbox.core.Filter.
Defined in ElementaryFilter.js

An elementary filter is a condition on a field. For example state='California' is an elementary filter. In this example state is the field, = is the operator and 'California' is the value. An "exportable" rapresentation of a filter is an object in this format: 

 {fieldId: < The id of the field &mt;, operatorId: <The id of the operator &mt;, values: < The values &mt;}
An elementary filter has an id, but is automatically generated, it's not exported by getFilterObj

Constructor Detail

Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter

Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter(field, operator)
    Build a new elementaryFilter. The second (optional) argument is the operator for the elementaryFilter. If none is supplied, is the default operator of the field. If the second argument is undefined or null and the default operator is null an exception is thrown. If the operator is supplied but it's not supported by the field an exception is thrown.
    Parameters:
      Ext.ux.netbox.core.Field field - The Field owner of this elementaryFilter.
      Ext.ux.netbox.core.Operator operator - Optional. The Operator for the filter. If not supplied the default operator is used.

removeValue

removeValue(value)
    This method remove a value for this elementaryFilter. If the value is not found an exception is thrown.
    Parameters:
      String value - The value to remove for this Filter

setFilterObj

setFilterObj(filter)
    This method, given a javascript object representing an elementaryFilter, sets the elementaryFilter itself.
    The format is the following: 
    {fieldId : "<fieldId>", operatorId : "<operatorId>", values : [...]}
    Parameters:
      Object filter - The object containing the elementaryFilter to set

setOperator

setOperator(operator)
    This method sets the Operator for this elementaryFilter passing the Ext.ux.netbox.core.Operator or a String containing the operator's Id. If the operator is not supported by the elementaryFilter an exception is throw. This function fires the operatorChanged event. The old value of the elementaryFilter is converted using the covertValue method of the new operator.
    Parameters:
      Ext.ux.netbox.core.Operator or String operator - The Operator for this elementaryFilter or the operator's Id

setValues

setValues(values)
    This method set a list of values for this elementaryFilter. This method fires a valueChanged event. The values must be an Array. If it's not an array an exception is thrown. The empty value is an empty array. If values is null or undefined an exception is thrown. If the given values are equal (compared using json encode) to the actual values, no event is fired.
    Parameters:
      Array values - The values for this elementaryFilter

    Fires when a operator is changed
    Parameters:

    Parameters:
